title: Laggy Discord Stream? Try These Troubleshooting Tips

steps.title: Toggling Hardware Acceleration fixes laggy streams for most users.
steps.content: Toggling Hardware Acceleration fixes laggy streams for most users. For some users, turning Hardware Acceleration off will fix a laggy stream. For others, they need to turn Hardware Acceleration on . Try enabling or disabling Hardware Acceleration. If your stream lag doesn't get any better—or gets worse—switch Hardware Acceleration back to the setting it was before. The Hardware Acceleration setting can be found in Settings > Voice & Video . There is also a Hardware Acceleration setting in Settings > Advanced . Disabling one Hardware Acceleration setting will not disable the other.

steps.title: Try disabling high-priority packets to fix lag.
steps.content: Try disabling high-priority packets to fix lag. The Quality of Service High Packet Priority setting lets your router know that Discord's packets are high priority, so they should get transmitted first. However, this setting can cause problems for some users, and disabling it may fix a laggy stream. The Quality of Service High Packet Priority setting can be found in Settings > Voice & Video .

steps.title: Discord's OpenH264 video codec can cause a laggy stream.
steps.content: Discord's OpenH264 video codec can cause a laggy stream. To check, try enabling or disabling the Open H264 video codec. If your Discord stream lag doesn't improve, switch the video codec back to the setting it was before. The OpenH264 Video Codec setting can be found in Settings > Voice & Video .

steps.title: Sometimes, system glitches can cause Discord to stop working properly.
steps.content: Sometimes, system glitches can cause Discord to stop working properly. If you haven't had any luck adjusting your Discord settings, restarting your computer can fix these random bugs and glitches. Once your computer is back on, check Discord to see if the stream is still laggy.

steps.title: A laggy stream could be caused by a sub-optimal internet connection.
steps.content: A laggy stream could be caused by a sub-optimal internet connection. Issues with your modem or router often cause these problems. Restart your router if all network processes are laggy. If your modem or router has a power button, use that to turn it off and back on. Otherwise, unplug the modem or router for a few seconds, then plug it back in. If you live with other people, make sure that it's okay to restart the modem or router first, as this will cause the internet in your house to go down momentarily.

steps.title: Sometimes, a laggy stream is caused by a Windows permissions problem.
steps.content: Sometimes, a laggy stream is caused by a Windows permissions problem. You can resolve this by running Discord in administrator mode. To do this, search for Discord in the taskbar search bar, right-click it, and select Run as administrator . If running Discord as an administrator fixed the problem, you might want to always run Discord as an administrator. To do this, right-click the Discord icon on your desktop, select Properties , then click the Compatibility tab. Check the box that says "Run as an administrator" and click OK to save.

steps.title: Ethernet connections are faster than Wi-Fi connections.
steps.content: Ethernet connections are faster than Wi-Fi connections. If you are currently connecting to the internet with Wi-Fi, switching to a wired connection can get rid of stream lag. Using an Ethernet cable is more reliable and gets you faster internet speeds, which can help improve your stream performance on Discord. For the best performance, use a Cat 5e, Cat 6, or Cat 6a ethernet cable.

steps.title: DirectX might be causing the issues.
steps.content: DirectX might be causing the issues. Dxdiag (or the DirectX Diagnostic Tool) is a tool that reports information about your DirectX components and drivers. Some users have reported that they've fixed a laggy Discord stream by checking dxdiag for problems. [1] X Research source To do this, type dxdiag in the taskbar search bar, then click "dxdiag" to run it. The dxdiag icon is blue with a yellow "x" on it. Allow dxdiag to finish loading, then click on each tab and check the "Notes" section for any issues. If dxdiag finds a problem, resolve it before checking Discord again. If dxdiag says a program or file is causing problems, but you're not sure what that program or file does, research it before you remove it. Accidentally removing files or programs that your computer needs can cause it to stop working entirely.

steps.title: Make sure your internet connection is stable.
steps.content: Make sure your internet connection is stable. If you're having trouble with your internet connection, it can cause issues with your Discord stream. Below are some of the reasons your connection might be unstable and how you can fix it: Poor Wi-Fi signal: Move your computer closer to the router/modem, ensuring there are no brick or metal walls between them Wi-Fi card driver issues: Update your Wi-Fi card drivers, or roll them back to a stable version if the update caused the problems Worn or old Ethernet cable: Replace with a new Cat 5e, Cat 6, or Cat 6a Ethernet cable Modem or router issue: Replace the modem or router (if you own it) or ask your internet service provider for a new one (if you rent it from your ISP) Outage: Wait for your ISP to fix the issue

steps.title: Lowering your stream's quality frees up resources on your PC.
steps.content: Lowering your stream's quality frees up resources on your PC. Discord offers a few stream qualities to choose from: 720p, 1080p, 1440p, and source. To change your stream quality mid-stream, click on the streaming button in Discord, then select a different quality in the Stream Quality menu. 1080p is only available for Nitro and Nitro Classic subscribers, and 1440p is only available for Discord Nitro subscribers. If you don't have Discord Nitro, try switching from 720p to source. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Other open programs might be using up excess bandwidth.
steps.content: Other open programs might be using up excess bandwidth. If you have any open applications that are using up your internet bandwidth, close them (excluding the game you're streaming, if it connects to the internet). If someone you live with is gaming, streaming video, or doing other bandwidth-intensive activities, this could also affect your stream quality.

steps.title: Old graphics card drivers can cause issues, including laggy Discord streams.
steps.content: Old graphics card drivers can cause issues, including laggy Discord streams. Make sure your graphics card drivers are up to date to ensure the best stream quality in Discord. To update your GPU drivers, open your GPU software (such as AMD Radeon Software or NVIDIA GeForce) and install any pending driver updates.

steps.title: Some have found less lag when streaming via their browser.
steps.content: Some have found less lag when streaming via their browser. Sometimes, switching to the browser version of Discord can fix laggy stream problems. If you switch to the browser version of Discord and your stream no longer lags, the issue is likely with the Discord app itself. To do this, go to https://discord.com/app and sign in with your Discord account. Then, go to the server or DM you were streaming in and try again to see if the lag is gone.

steps.title: Delete your Discord cache to clear out old, stale data.
steps.content: Delete your Discord cache to clear out old, stale data. A cache is used to store temporary data. However, sometimes this data becomes corrupt or just gets old and can't be used anymore, and the cache will then start causing the application not to work properly anymore. To clear your Discord cache , go to \AppData\Roaming\discord on Windows or ~/Library/Application Support/discord on Mac. Within this folder, delete the Cache , CodeCache , and GPUCache folders. You can then open Discord and try streaming again to see if the issue is fixed.

steps.title: Completely reinstall Discord if nothing else works.
steps.content: Completely reinstall Discord if nothing else works. Simply uninstall your Discord application. Then, download the latest Discord installer from https://discord.com and install it.

steps.title: If problems persist, Discord Support can help.
steps.content: If problems persist, Discord Support can help. Go to Discord's request submission form and select Help & Support from the dropdown. Then, fill out the form with your information and any applicable details. Discord will respond via email for further assistance.
